item.title: 韩元创三个月新低，韩国誓言抗击波动性
item.description: 韩国财政部长承诺迅速采取行动抑制韩元的过度波动，这是韩元跌至三个月低点后官员们对韩元日益紧张的最新迹象。【原文：South Korea’s finance minister has promised to act swiftly to curb excessive volatility in the won, the latest sign officials are growing nervous about the currency after it fell to a three-month low.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚禁止销售苹果 iPhone 16 以争取投资
item.description: 印度尼西亚已阻止苹果公司在这个东南亚最大经济体销售其最新的 iPhone 16 设备，称该公司尚未达到国内投资要求。【原文：Indonesia has blocked Apple Inc. from selling its latest iPhone 16 devices in Southeast Asia’s largest economy, saying the company has yet to meet domestic investment requirements.】

item.title: 交易员期待印度股市迎来吉祥周
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 乌拉圭大选进入决胜阶段，养老金改革遭否决
item.description: 乌拉圭总统大选将于下月举行决选，因为两位候选人都没有达到获胜所需的绝对多数，而一项有争议的国家养老金制度改革方案也未能获得通过。【原文：Uruguay’s presidential election will go to a runoff next month after neither candidate reached the absolute majority needed to win, while a contentious overhaul of the country’s pension system failed to pass.】

item.title: 越南 Vingroup 为初创企业设立 1.5 亿美元基金
item.description: 一份通过电子邮件发送的声明称，越南企业集团 Vingroup JSC 正在启动一项价值 1.5 亿美元的基金，以支持东南亚地区的科技初创企业，这些企业专注于人工智能、半导体和云计算等领域。【原文：Vietnamese conglomerate Vingroup JSC is starting a $150 million fund to back technology startups across Southeast Asia that focus on areas including artificial intelligence, semiconductors and cloud computing, according to an emailed statement.】

item.title: 中国人民银行将直接逆回购纳入货币政策工具箱
item.description: 中国央行正在引入所谓的彻底逆回购协议作为货币政策工具。【原文：China’s central bank is introducing so-called outright reverse repurchase agreements as a monetary policy tool.】

item.title: 香港房屋销售上升仍面临经济阻力
item.description: 由于香港经济前景疲软，利率高企，预计香港房屋销售的上升势头将举步维艰。【原文：Hong Kong’s home sales uptick is expected to struggle with momentum due to the city’s weak economic outlook and elevated interest rates.】

item.title: 对冲基金在大选前抛售日元引发日本风险
item.description: 在日本执政党自民党未能在大选中获得多数席位之前的一周，对冲基金转而看跌日元，这有可能扩大日元的损失。【原文：Hedge funds turned bearish on the yen in the week before Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party failed to gain majority at a general election, threatening to amplify losses in the currency.】

item.title: 澳大利亚总理为免费升级澳航航班辩护
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞（Anthony Albanese）受到压力，要求他解释与澳航（Qantas Airways Ltd.）的关系，此前他被指控从该航空公司获得大量免费升舱服务，并直接与前老板艾伦-乔伊斯（Alan Joyce）联系航班事宜。【原文：Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is under pressure to explain his relationship with Qantas Airways Ltd. after allegations he received a raft of free upgrades from the airline and liaised directly about his flights with ex-boss Alan Joyce.】

item.title: 奥林巴斯首席执行官因购买药物指控被调查而离职
item.description: 奥林巴斯公司首席执行官在公司对其购买非法药物的指控进行调查后，发现其行为与公司政策不符，因此辞职。【原文：Olympus Corp.’s chief executive officer resigned after the company conducted an investigation into an allegation he bought illegal drugs, finding behaviors inconsistent with company policy.】

item.title: 波音计划最快于下周一增资逾 150 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，波音公司计划最早于下周一启动增资计划，此次增资将帮助这家陷入困境的飞机制造商提高流动性。【原文：Boeing Co. is planning to launch a capital hike as early as Monday, according to people familiar with the matter, in an offering that would help the beleaguered airplane maker boost its liquidity.】

item.title: 以色列对伊朗的有限打击抑制避险需求，黄金下跌
item.description: 在以色列周末对伊朗的打击似乎比许多人预期的更为克制之后，黄金从接近纪录高位的水平走低。【原文：Gold edged lower from near record-high levels after Israeli strikes on Iran over the weekend appeared to be more restrained than many expected.】

item.title: 日本大选后政局不稳，日元暴跌
item.description: 2024 年 10 月 27 日（星期日），日本东京，一名行人站在 "Nebuta "花车旁的选举公告牌前，公告牌上张贴着候选人的海报。日本将于周日举行全国大选，选民将决定是否让丑闻缠身的自民党继续执政。【原文：A pedestrian in front of an election notice board displaying posters of candidates next to a 'Nebuta" float in Tokyo, Japan, on Sunday, Oct. 27, 2024. Japan looks set for one of its closest national elections in years as voters go to the polls Sunday to decide whether to keep the scandal-tainted Liberal Democratic Party in power.】

item.title: 亚洲进入最繁忙的财报周，中国银行成关注焦点
item.description: 亚洲已进入最繁忙的财报周，投资者可能会重点关注中国和香港上市银行的业绩，从中寻找中国政府刺激措施潜在影响的线索。【原文：Asia has entered its busiest week for earnings, with investors likely to focus on the results of Chinese and Hong Kong-listed banks for clues on the potential impact of Beijing’s stimulus measures.】

item.title: 众议院选举结果和金融市场反应。
item.description: 2024 年 10 月 27 日星期日，日本东京，日本首相兼自民党总裁石破茂在下议院选举后的自民党总部。根据日本公共广播公司 NHK 的预测，日本自民党将在周日的选举中失去多数党地位，执政联盟能否保住政权尚存悬念。【原文：Shigeru Ishiba, Japan's prime minister and president of the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), at the party's headquarters following the lower house election, at the party's headquarters in Tokyo, Japan, on Sunday, Oct. 27, 2024. Japan’s Liberal Democratic Party is set to lose its majority in Sunday’s election, according to a forecast from public broadcaster NHK, leaving in the balance whether the ruling coalition will hold on to power.】

item.title: 日本大选令投资者不安，日元下跌：市场综述
item.description: 日本执政联盟在周末的选举中未能赢得议会多数席位，日元跌至近三个月来的最弱水平。原油在以色列袭击伊朗石油设施后下跌。【原文：The yen fell to its weakest level in almost three months after Japan’s ruling coalition failed to win a majority in parliament at the weekend’s election. Crude fell after Israeli strikes on Iran avoided oil facilities.】

item.title: 联盟失去多数席位后，策略师认为日本资产将下跌
item.description: 在自民党领导的执政联盟自 2009 年以来首次未能赢得议会多数席位后，日元和日本股市周一将下跌。【原文：The yen and Japanese shares look set to decline Monday after the ruling coalition led by the Liberal Democratic Party failed to win a majority in parliament for the first time since 2009.】

item.title: 矿产资源部称调查将于下周结束
item.description: 矿产资源有限公司（Mineral Resources Ltd.）表示，将在下周完成对向与其富豪创始人克里斯-埃里森（Chris Ellison）有关联的公司支付未申报款项的调查。【原文：Mineral Resources Ltd. said its investigation into undeclared payments made to companies linked to its tycoon founder, Chris Ellison, would be completed by next week.】

item.title: 以色列对伊朗的打击仅限于军事目标，石油暴跌 5
item.description: 由于以色列周末对伊朗的打击避开了欧佩克成员国的石油设施，石油价格下跌。【原文：Oil tumbled as Israeli strikes on Iran over the weekend avoided the OPEC member’s oil facilities.】

item.title: 自民党选举受挫，日元走软，日本股市面临压力
item.description: 自民党及其联盟伙伴在紧急选举中遭到沉重打击后，日元跌至三个月低点，日本股市周一也将下滑。【原文：The yen fell to three-month low and Japanese stocks were set to slip Monday after the Liberal Democratic Party and its coalition partner were dealt a heavy blow in a snap election.】

item.title: 孟买制药商如何帮助普京获得英伟达人工智能芯片
item.description:
贸易跟踪数据显示，印度公司正在向俄罗斯销售针对人工智能进行了优化的戴尔高端服务器。【原文：

Trade-tracking data show that the Indian firm is selling top-end Dell servers optimized for artificial intelligence to Russia.

】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 财报季即将来临，英国石油公司（BP Plc）将于本周二揭开石油巨头第三季度财报的序幕。与此同时，黄金生产商的财报也在陆续出炉。在农业领域，世界上使用最广泛的植物油价格飙升，再次引发了人们对粮食通胀的担忧。【原文：Earnings season is upon us, with BP Plc kicking off third-quarter results for the oil supermajors on Tuesday. Meanwhile, earnings reports from gold producers are rolling in. In agriculture, prices for the world’s most widely used vegetable oil are soaring, reigniting concerns about food inflation.】

item.title: 受政策前景影响，澳元兑新西兰元汇率测试年内高点
item.description: 由于决策者对利率前景的看法不一，投资者认为澳元兑新西兰元将测试今年的高点。【原文：Investors see the Australian dollar testing this year’s high against its New Zealand counterpart as policymakers diverge on the interest-rate outlook.】

item.title: 法国政府为削减开支瞄准旷工问题
item.description: 法国政府计划在明年的预算中削减 50 亿欧元（54 亿美元）的开支，作为一系列措施的一部分，法国政府计划打击公务员缺勤现象并减少发展援助。【原文：The French government plans to crack down on absenteeism in the civil service and reduce development aid as part of a series of measures aimed at delivering €5 billion ($5.4 billion) of spending cuts in next year’s budget.】

item.title: 以色列悄悄夸耀攻打伊朗的战略收益
item.description: 在出动 100 多架战斗机袭击伊朗之后，以色列政府正试图在一条微妙的界线上行走：以色列官员认为这次袭击造成了重大的战略损害，但又希望伊朗继续将其视为不值得回应的攻击。【原文：After sending more than 100 fighter planes to attack Iran, the Israeli government is seeking to walk a fine line: Officials there believe the attack did significant strategic damage but want to allow Iran to continue dismissing it as unworthy of response.】

item.title: 省长表示，安大略省将把汽油税减免政策延长至 2025 年 6 月
item.description: 安大略省省长道格-福特（Doug Ford）在周日的新闻发布会上表示，安大略省计划将汽油和柴油税的临时减税措施延长至明年 6 月。【原文：Ontario plans to extend a temporary cut to gasoline and diesel taxes to next June, Premier Doug Ford said at a news conference Sunday.】

item.title: 受大跌打击的债券市场即将迎来 10 天考验
item.description: 美国债券市场已经遭受了六个月来最严重的抛售，现在正进入关键的两周，这两周很可能将决定今年余下时间的走势。【原文：The US bond market, already stung by the worst selloff in six months, now heads into a crucial two-week stretch that will likely chart its course for the rest of the year.】

item.title: 盈利增长放缓，大型科技股失去光环
item.description: 随着科技巨头们准备在本周公布财报，利润增长放缓正在消除股市中的一些不稳定性。它们能否扭转这一趋势，将在很大程度上决定股市能否继续反弹。【原文：Slowing profit growth is removing some of the invincibility surrounding the stock market’s technology giants as they prepare to report earnings this week. Whether they can reverse that trend will go a long way to determining if the rally in equities can keep going.】

item.title: 苹果将对 Mac 进行期待已久的 M4 芯片大修
item.description:
另外：有关公司即将推出的智能家居设备的最新细节。【原文：

Also: fresh details on the company’s upcoming smart home device.

】

item.title: 通用大西洋公司开设沙特办事处，探寻中东地区交易
item.description: 通用大西洋公司（General Atlantic）以对 Facebook 和优步（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：General Atlantic, best known for early stage investments in tech companies such as Facebook and Uber Technologies Inc., is opening its first office in the Middle East as it looks to scout for more deals in the region.】
